result.execSummary:
The defendant William Howard Duvall III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 4/29/2022.
Probation review hearing in Branch 35 on July 22, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory supervision  fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs and fees.

Court advised defendant of right to sek postconviction relief.
Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim R.D.B. unless approved by the Court. Third paty contact for the purpose of child visitation, third party to be approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers intervention program.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Howard Duvall III

records.addlTxt:
court review memo dated 7/11/2022, filed.

Per filing of the agent, defendant is in absconder status. Court cancels probation review hearing.

Defendant William Howard Duvall in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant William Howard Duvall in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 1 DISMISSED and READ-IN for sentencing purposes.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form, filed.

Defendant William Howard Duvall in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant William Howard Duvall in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant William Howard Duvall not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing and to Justice Point Services.

Court ordered no contact with RDB (DOB 3/17/80) or her children; her residence; 2829 N. Fratney St.; 409 E. Chambers St.; 2968 N. Buffum St.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant William Howard Duvall in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant William Howard Duvall in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William Howard Duvall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
